conclusion: Use given information about electric potential, motion of the ball, and forces involved.
Electric potential along ON is given by formula: phi = (kQ/L)x.
Ball's motion described by equation: m(d^2x/dt^2) = mg - F.
Electric force F is given by F = k(Q^2/x^2).
Identify given values: Q = Q, k = k, L = sqrt(2)L, g = 2g.
Electric force at point M is F = k(Q^2/L^2).
Velocity of ball at N is zero.
Velocity at M is v = d/dt.
Substitute F = k(Q^2/L^2) into motion equation: m(d^2x/dt^2) = mg - k(Q^2/L^2).
Calculate electric force at M: F = k(Q^2/L^2).
Determine magnitude of electric force: k(Q^2/L^2).
Conclude magnitude of electric force experienced by ball at M is k(Q^2/L^2).
